result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick X. Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick X. Cooper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Patrick X. Cooper was found guilty of Soliciting a Child for Prostitution, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.08.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Not eligible for Challenge or Substance Abuse Programs.
May have contact with his minor son.  May have incidental contact only with other minors.

superMiscConds.notes:
$268.00 + $250.00 costs due thru EXTENDED SUPERVISION.
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
